metadata.Title: CVE-2021-31229 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in libezxml.a in ezXML 0.8.6. The function ezxml_internal_dtd() performs incorrect memory handling while parsing crafted XML files, which leads to an out-of-bounds write of a one byte constant.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-31229` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

scilab - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-cli - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-data - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-full-bin - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-include - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-minimal-bin - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-test - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mapcache package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
navit package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
netcdf package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
scilab package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1').
